Referred to Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A bill to amend the Arms Export Control Act to require that, in considering proposed military co-production arrangements with foreign countries, there be greater interagency coordination within the executive branch, increased consideration of the economic and trade implications of these arrangements, and consultation with the Members of Congress representing areas which may be adversely affected by the co-production abroad.

latestAction.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a tax credit for expenditures to remove architectural and transportation barriers to the handicapped and elderly.

latestAction.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

sponsoredLegislation.title: Automotive Economic Recovery Tax Act of 1981

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Commerce, Transportation and Tourism.

sponsoredLegislation.title: Emergency Automobile Regulatory Relief Act of 1981

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Postsecondary Education.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution to express the intention of Congress to make no legislative changes in the Guaranteed Student Loan Program which would be effective prior to October 1, 1981, and to prohibit the Secretary of Education from taking any action to make any administrative changes in that program prior to such date.
A resolution to express the sense of the House of Representatives with respect to funding of Pell grants.

A resolution limiting the amount provided in expense resolutions for committees of the House of Representatives for the second session of the Ninety-seventh Congress to the amount actually spent under such resolutions for the first session of the Ninety-seventh Congress.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Human Resources.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A resolution urging the Congress to authorize funding of the Headstart Program.

A resolution limiting the aggregate of all expense resolution authorization levels for the standing and select committees of the House of Representatives to 90 percent of the aggregate expenditure levels of such committees for the second sessions of the 96th Congress.
